channel.title: Slides on Praxis
channel.description: Recent content in Slides on Praxis

item.title: Situated Cognition
item.description: Situated Cognition Embodied // Extended A talk for Sensory Engagement Lab Brainbound The (nonneural) body is just the sensor and effector system of the brain, and the world is just the arena in which adaptive problems get posed and in which the brain–body system must sense and act. All human cognition depends directly on neural activity alone. Extended Includes inextricable tangles of feedback, feed-forward, and feed-around loops: loops that promiscuously criss-cross the boundaries of brain, body, and world.

item.title: ✨wish
item.description: {{page.title}} {{page.description}} A {{ partial "logo.html" . }} and collaboration What it is facilitates #needs and #offers in a community taxonomy is defined bottom-up by #tags regions are defined bottom-up by geofencing {{ partial "wish/story1-1.svg" . }} #compost Denise searches for a #compost #offer nearby. {{ partial "wish/story1-2.svg" . }} #compost Denise enters a private room with Mary, the one #offering the #compost.
